snippet: Should a critic have his feet on the ground, or his head in the clouds, when it comes to strapped budgets in the classical music world? Anthony Tommasini makes his case.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reflects on responsibilities of critics of classical music and opera in light of criticism directed at him by Reynold Levy, former president of Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, in memoir They Told Me Not to Take That Job.
lead_paragraph: Should a critic have his feet on the ground, or his head in the clouds, when it comes to strapped budgets in the classical music world? Anthony Tommasini makes his case.

headline.main: In an Age of Less, the Critic Demands More
headline.print_headline: A Duty to Demand More in an Age of Less
